mention.text: South Bay firefighters , who know South Bay firefighters may be no more than a careless match away from a blaze as intense and unpredictable as the one that devastated the Oakland hills last Sunday Now , in the wake of that firestorm , local firefighters are looking up at the hills that surround this area and wondering not whether , but only when and where
the hills that surround this area
no coincidence that six of California 's 10 most damaging wildfires have occurred since 1980
Saratoga Fire Chief Ernest Kraule know the wake of that firestorm

there , said Saratoga Fire Chief Ernest Kraule Every fire chief there is 12 of us in this county knows it is there ; The danger is in the Saratoga foothills , where Kraule 's department has battled nine deliberately set fires since June most recently Oct. 19 , the same day Oakland firefighters thought local firefighters had contained a brush fire that a day later blossomed into the deadly firestorm
the mountain communities that straddle Highway 9 in Santa Cruz County , isolated by weak bridges that wo not support some firetrucks and connected by a two-lane road that will hinder escape
Highway 9 in Santa Cruz County , isolated by weak bridges that wo not support some firetrucks and connected by a two-lane road that will hinder escape
weak bridges that wo not support some firetrucks
Los Altos Hills , unwilling to suffer even that inconvenience
California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection 's
chief of the forestry department 's San Mateo-Santa Cruz ranger unit city dwellers

the risks you take when you live in an area like this , said Dean Lucke , chief of the forestry department 's San Mateo-Santa Cruz ranger unit city dwellers ca not guarantee everyone 's safety up here at all times

Fremont Fire Chief Dan Lydon , whose department would be one of the first called to a fire in Kilkare If there is an area that has the significant potential for disaster , that is one ; Codes rarely enforced ; In the hills , nearly every home is surrounded by thick brush or dense woods Fire
an area that has the significant potential for disaster , that is one
a battalion chief for the Palo Alto Fire Department
The lesson of the Oakland hills
even the smallest fires as quickly as possible
Emerald Lake Hills above Redwood City
a battalion chief for the Redwood City Fire Department
a good question , said O.J. Burrell , chief of fire prevention at the San Mateo-Santa Cruz ranger unit
Highway 9 between Santa Cruz and Boulder Creek
chief of the Santa Cruz city fire department
Sharon Whaley , spokeswoman for the San Jose Water Co.
spokeswoman for the San Jose Water Co.
